method.name: Relief

reference.ref: K. Kira and L. Rendell, A practical approach to feature selection. In Sleeman and P. Edwards, Eds, Proceedings of the Ninth International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML-92), Morgan Kaufmann, (1992) 249-256.

generalDescription.objective: Feature Selection. This method allows search to follow feature subsets
generalDescription.howWork: FS-Relief selects features that are statistically relevant. Therefore, two nearest neighbours (one instance for each class) are sought for each given instance (I), one is near-hit (H), the other is near-mis (J). Ideally, a feature is relevant if each value are the same between I and near-hit, and different between I and near-mis. The relevant feature are those having theirs weight exceeding a relevant threshold (relevanceThreshold). This relevanceThreshold can be determine by a statistical method of interval estimation. The sample size numInstancesSampled can be varied and a large number numInstancesSampled implies more reliable approximation.

parameterSpec.param: paramKNN: is the number of nearest neighbours used by the k-NN classifier
relevanceThreshold is a final threshold that selects the features (its weights must improve this value)
numInstancesSampled is the number of instances that the method needs
